title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 111.1 - New York taxable income of a resident individual
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 111.1 - New York taxable income of a resident individual

State Regulations

Tax Law, ยง 611(a)
(a) General. The New York taxable income of a resident individual is
such individual's New York adjusted gross income (see section
112.1
of this Article) reduced by such individual's New York standard deduction or
itemized deduction and such individual' s New York exemptions (see Parts 114, 115 and 116 of this Article). (b) A resident individual's New York taxable
income is subject to the New York State personal income tax on New York taxable
income as set forth in sections
601
and
699
of the Tax Law (see section
101.2
of this

Title). Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
ยง
111.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
